title: The Design, Creation and Survival of Democratic Laws
descriptions:
The DEMOLAW project aims to explore the intricate relationship between the design, creation, and survival of democratic laws in the political systems of the US, UK, and EU. By analyzing legislative texts using cutting-edge computational methods, this project seeks to answer three major research questions: What conceptual dimensions influence the design of a law? Why does the design of democratic legislation vary across different political systems? How can we explain the stability or change in laws over time?

The proposed research will make significant contributions to the field by offering a novel conceptual perspective on legislative design, developing an integrated theoretical framework on legislation creation and survival, and advancing methodological techniques for the computational analysis of legislative content. The project will focus on the analytical dimensions of versatility and precision to ensure accurate and comprehensive results.

By shedding light on the underlying factors that shape legislative outcomes in democratic societies, the DEMOLAW project has the potential to inform policy-making, legal scholarship, and democratic theory. Through its interdisciplinary approach and innovative methodologies, this project will deepen our understanding of the complex dynamics that govern the evolution of laws in democratic political systems.
